intro: Magnolia pumila, commonly known as the dwarf magnolia, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern China. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves that remain on the shrub throughout the year. It is well-suited for hedges or as a compact specimen plant in gardens. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping due to its aesthetic appeal and hardiness.
